IMF calls on China to cut industrial subsidies in half

Open thread • Replies: 124 • Updated: 2026-02-21 15:10 UTC

OP

Early replies (first 3)

61872971
>>61872964
This is a strategic move by the Chinese to kill off the competition in other countries so the Chinese companies can dominate the sectors and then raise the prices

61872974
i'm sure china will get right on that

61872978
jews mad
>>61872971
they can do it forever without raising the prices

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61878126
>>61878121
>/pol/tard word salad gibberish complete with the "hyperinflation" meme word

61878133
>>61878126
Wumao
China is dead and has been for the better part of 13 years. All the corruption and attempts to paint over the political and economic failures are now coming home all at the same time. There won't be a "people" 'republic' of China by 2030

>>61878133
I think you're Indian.

61878138
>>61878133
>more /pol/tard word salad gibberish complete with foreign language pejorative meme word

61878148
>>61878137
>>61878138
Wumaos
When the checks stop coming you gone. The rest of the country is going to slaughter you

61878155
>>61878148
>When the checks stop coming you gone
Confirmed Indian

61878160
>>61878155
Wumao, who do you think is first going to be rationalized away? You or chair man chang? You gonna die chink

61878162
>>61878109
They made a bet that reaching out infrastructure to the hundreds of millions of people of low-productivity regions could improve domestic demand to the extent that their subsidies start to be consumed internally. The problem is that the low-productivity areas are, of course, low income and the only two options which exist to them are:
>Direct UBI for low-income areas
>Creating even more highly subsidized factories to employ low-income people and give them a better wage
Honestly for them the UBI route is likely more cost-effective, to avoid further deflating the value of the plants they already have. The 3rd (much) more challenging and expensive option would be to migrate the sweat-shops and low-skill factories out to the countryside from bigger city centers and reassign the existing factories to high-tech, high-skill plants such as chip foundries and advanced component manufacturing. To a certain extent they're being forced into this already due to sanctions etc on high-end chips, but if it's their primary gameplan then it's progressing way too slowly. Modernizing a billion people (bugs) is a hell of a project

61878168
>>61878160
You're stinking up the thread.

61878171
>>61878162
>UBI
That's the funny part, the polity as the bureaucracy as the socialist "billionaire" bastards that rely on the continuation of the sovereign bond ponzis are going to hang on the same gallows

61878316
>>61878171
Are you ESL? I feel like I got schizophrenia just from reading your post

61880069
>>61874731
>17% of the US population who are hooked on SSRIs get their supplies cut off, along with the active ingredients we buy from them for everything else. We lost the bio-warfare game before it even began.

61880124
>>61875629
Everything done by a government can be construed as being a subsidy

Good infrastructure is a subsidy
Skilled workforce is a subsidy
Low crime rate is a subsidy
Friendly regulatory environment is a subsidy
Low cost of living for employees is a subsidy
Ease of worker relocation and efficient job matching is a subsidy
Low taxes due to government thrift is a subsidy
Etc

61880265
>>61873120
On the world though? Also where would China be without Amazon and Walmart like worse than Thailand.

61880291
>>61875302
>If a basket of various goods in the US goes for 100 dollars and that same basket of goods in Vietnam goes for 10 dollars (ALL ELSE BEING EQUAL), then a fair exchange rate would be 10 dong for one dollar
That is a made up rule. There is no fundamental reason for why 1 dong should have the same purchasing power as 1 dollar. Currency units are just made up. Vietnam could introduce a new currency superunit called the bong, say 1 bong is equal to 25,970 dong and also that 1 bong is equal to 1 dollar. That would satisfy your rule while also de facto maintaining the current exchange rate.

There is a natural reason for why the basket is cheaper in dollar terms in Vietnam, which is the Balassa-Samuelson effect

>There’s a reason why economists or even someone casually interested in the economy and trade policy use these terms.
Yes, because they are shills trying to find arguments for why China should make Chinese companies less competitive and/or arguments for why tariffs should be imposed against China. It's really all just to protect the profits of domestic companies

61880312
>>61880291
>say 1 bong is equal to 25,970 dong and also that 1 bong is equal to 1 dollar.
*say 1 bong is equal to 2,597 dong and also that 10 bong are equal to 1 dollar

61880533
>>61880291
>my rule
>it’s literally just the most basic economics
Listen, I can’t explain exchange rates to you any more than I already have. Believe whatever you want. If you want to believe that exchange rates do not affect exporters or importers, go for it. It’s of no consequence to me if you sound retarded.

61880545
>>61880069
>leftists kill themselves en masse after their meds run out leading to a 100 year Republican dynasty
Still not seeing the downside

61880558
>>61880545
The downside is that the mentally sound people are not going to just off themselves. They are going to take it out on everyone around them like they normally do.

61880563
>>61880558
mentally ill*
Ultimately its going to be an improvement.

61880603
>>61880533
It's not "basic economics".

Fiat currency units are arbitrary. Fiat currencies have no inherent or fair value because they aren't tied to anything real.

>If you want to believe that exchange rates do not affect exporters or importers
That's not what I was saying

61880653
>>61880603
>>61875302
Again, a currency does not have to have an underlying physical asset in order to have value in relation to something else. I’m not sure why you think it does.

This is not my pet theory. It’s just basic economics. Just look into Purchasing Power Parity, and if you don’t get it, that’s fine. Again, you can believe whatever you want. I’ve done my due diligence.

61880707
Give it to me straight: Has China already won? It seems to be doing better than the west.

61880739
>>61880653
I'm not saying a fiat currency can't have value relative to something else. I'm saying it does not have an inherent or fair value, and therefore it cannot be undervalued or overvalued.

When I said a fiat currency is not tied to anything real, I meant that it's not backed by anything real fixed at any specific predetermined ratio. I did not mean that it cannot be exchanged for anything real.

I'm familiar with PPP, and there is no reason why it should be the exchange rate.

61880750
>>61873505
currency you nigger, currency, not money.

61880812
>>61880739
> I'm saying it does not have an inherent or fair value, and therefore it cannot be undervalued or overvalued.
It can be in relation to something else.
If one dong can buy a bicycle in Vietnam, and a dollar can buy a bicycle in the US, and this 1:1 ratio roughly carries across a multitude of good, and Vietnam’s nominal exchange rate for USD is 100:1, the currency is undervalued. It is worth much more than the nominal exchange rate suggests. Its real value *in relation to the US dollar* is higher than its nominal value.
> there is no reason why it should be the exchange rate.
It is not the exchange rate. It is a factor in the exchange rate. The reason makes sense.

It is important to understand that we are talking about managed exchange rates here, and it’s much more obvious in these examples. Many economists also think that currencies can be undervalued/overvalued even if both currencies float freely.

61880827
>>61872964
As if China will give a shit.

61880935
>>61880707
Yes, considering where all the gold and silver is going.

61882682
>>61872964
Jews have no power in China

61883413
What is even supposed to be illegal about a government subsidizing a critical infrastructure industry and innovation?

>government spends trillion dollars on nigger welfare with negative ROI
or
>government spends trillion on energy, housing, vehicles with long term national benefits

who the fuck decides what a country can spend their tax income from?

Some think that the bear market is just starting so maybe it's better to wait... but idk, the sentiment seems rather depressed already. Anyone else also accumulating rn or ar you waiting for october? 61880848
>>61880730

61881053
>>61880718
all other macro bottoms took several months of crabbing before the markets went up again, we havent done that yet
probably better to wait it out and only deploy capital when its clear the trend has shifted

like last macro bottom in late 2022, if you waited till conformation you bought at 18k instead of 16k, a marginal difference
i'll assume that nobody actually nabbed the 60k bottom here for how short it was

>>61881053

unless you believe the snap back up will be violent, which is hard to do with sentiment this bad
even on the fakest V-est of v-dips during corona you had a good while to buy at 4k
and like i said you already missed the 60k window

>>61882954

friend of mine dabbled into leveraged trading a few years ago. he told me he couldnt sleep for weeks, his heart rate was always in the 150`s and his overall quality of life was very very life. he did all that and still lost close to 20k in just a few months. he had a masters in mechanical engineering so he wasnt a complete retard. why do you say all that because I believe you are a retard and you will lose everything just like everyone else trading to do leveraged trading.

item.title: Is it even possible to make it by opening a traditional business anymore? — 11 replies — 13.1/hr
item.content:encoded:
Is it even possible to make it by opening a traditional business anymore?

Open thread • Replies: 11 • Updated: 2026-02-21 14:26 UTC

OP

Read subject

Is it even possible? Not only do you have to jump through a million regulations and fees just to get started, you're also competing against trillion dollar mega corps who can and will undercut you because they employ ten thousand indians and illegals who work for pennies. Even traditional blue collar jobs like plumbers and HVAC are all slowly coagulating into one single corporate entity (in my area), and basically every single mom and pop store was killed during COVID.

It seems like the only way you can actually achieve anything is to basically trick angle investors into giving your bullshit tech start-up a ton of money or getting really lucky and have an app you make be bought out by a megacorp so they can rape your customers to death.

Pic unrelated

Early replies (first 3)

61881446
>>61881439
Step 1: get a girlfriend
Step 2: have her start an ASMR channel on YouTube
Step 3: have her start a merchandise line on shopify
There.

61881567
>>61881446
the pretty girl ASMR youtuber to OF is so undefeated.. Ive been watching ASMR for 8 years and the amount of hot ASMR girls that build a quick following and launch OF is high.

61881609
>>61881446
>Step 1: get a girlfriend
Do you have anything more realistic that I can accomplish?

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61881624
>>61881609
Become a trans vtuber. Work on your feminine voice.

61882459
>>61881439
Even trillion dollar companies can't do everything. The amount of bureaucracy involved to manage such a large entity is limiting in its own ways.
You have to find a niche that isn't currently being served in your market and then create a business for that.
For example: nobody is making catgirl gfs right now, it's a completely untapped market.

61882478
Corporations can now grow indefinetly due to advancement's in economic planning. It used to be theyd crash and burn after they got to a certain size.

61882584
>>61881624
This, also after few years of HRT start OF, get cosmetic surgeries to look like a bimbo

61882649
I'm not sure which is a worse feeling. The frustration of losing a bunch of games for dumb reasons or the anxiety of not wanting to fuck up a good winning streak.

61883247
>>61881439
It's possible, but made very difficult by design. Can't have too many people escaping the wage cage.

Everything is over regulated, because it means only mega corps have the resources to deal with the BS.

61883254
>>61881439
>a million regulations and fees just to get started

there are fees and regulations but they're not impossible to navigate, just look at how retardedness and drunkeness of the average trades small business owner.

but you're right about consolidation and private equity ownership. there's no way around this, other than killing PE jews or the people who sell out to PE.

61883298
>>61881446

item.title: why would anyone live here — 99 replies — 10.3/hr
item.content:encoded:
why would anyone live here

Open thread • Replies: 99 • Updated: 2026-02-21 05:42 UTC

OP

i recently moved to NYC to work for a "lucrative salary" (not really, because this place drains you of all your income) and after working here for 4 months i dont know why anyone would willingly live here

>the entire city smells like rotting shit, cigarette buds and dead animals, not a faint smell, an extremely strong odor that you'll eventually just become nose blind to

>homeless people, fucking everywhere, when i left my apartment there were homeless people sleeping in the hallways of my complex, when you go on walk there are homeless people sleeping on the sidewalk with a PILLOW and BLANKET while regular people walk over them like this is just some normal fucking occurrence (and in this shithole it is) never ever have i seen some shit like this even in the worst of cities ive lived in.

>heroin needles, weed bags, cigarette buds & the occasional dildo just scattered across the city sidewalks, your constantly walking over human shit, broken bottles or dime bags

>rats and rodents EVERYWHERE. il never forget the time i bought a pizza from one of the disgusting street vendors and when i sat down at a table one of the rats were circling my feet trying to climb my leg for a bite.

>the "public transport" system is a just permanent housing for the mentally ill, every time i had to ride the subway i was scared for my life because of all the fucking looneys that inhabit the train systems

this is just off the top of my head, but i think the biggest mindfuck of it all is that its EXPENSIVE to live here its gonna cost you not 50k, not 100k, not 200k, to live comfortably by yourself you need 250K yearly in manhattan. 250k, to live among violent homeless people, 250k to constantly have to walk in rotting shit and roadkill. 250k to have your ears blown out by car horns & niggerbabble, 250k to be forced to smell the most putried scents imaginable i dont know why anyone sane would live here, this place is some sort of social experiment, some sort of anonmoly.

item.title: SUNDAY ROAST: revolutionary tool or schizo cope? /biz/ decide — 6 replies — 10.3/hr
item.content:encoded:
SUNDAY ROAST: revolutionary tool or schizo cope? /biz/ decide

Open thread • Replies: 6 • Updated: 2026-02-21 14:42 UTC

OP

ok anons it's almost sunday. roast me.

i spent 4 years building semn.ai and the past 3 months building the cloud infra.

the idea: bitcoin price on a candle chart is a lossy compression of what's actually happening in the market. so i threw out the candles and built a completely different state space for BTC microstructure. a new lens that picks up regime shifts before they ever show up on your chart.

designed for scalpers. intraday high leverage degens. the kind of moves that are over before tradingview even renders the wick.

here's the cope part: i genuinely think this is novel. like, actually novel.

here's the seethe part: intraday BTC degens either don't know it exists or don't give a shit.

so /biz/, is this actually interesting or am i just another schizo who built a proprietary chart that only makes sense in my own head?

serious question. what would make you actually look at something like this? what would make you dismiss it immediately?

roast the concept, roast the site, roast me. i can take it.

semn.ai

Early replies (first 3)

61883221
>>61883194
pretty ui

61883262
I read what you wrote up until you said it was called semen AI. Then I stopped and posted this. That's about all the help you'll get out of me

61883266
>>61883221
thank you.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61883275
>>61883262
well actually... fair point
comes from Σεμναἲ Δεαὶ (Semnai Theai) (revered goddesses) in ancient Greek. I know the naming is controversial but for me this is the Revered Asset (btc).

61883297
>>61883194
So you built a trading bot? Does it perform?

61883336
>>61883297
not exactly. sure a bot could be built based on this. but the tool's intended purpose is to reduce cognitive debt whilst manually trading. it makes you money by avoiding bad trades, more than it does by getting you in trades. so discretionary. automated bot you get rekt. you can see the microstructure, know when you can leverage more, when to stay out. when it's dead. when is compression, when not to fade expansion. when there is aggressive / toxic flow. it's like weather channel for btc. you don't bet on it raining, but you know when to take your umbrella with you. does it make sense?
